content:
SynchronizedCollection<T> Class

Definition

Provides a thread-safe collection that contains objects of a type specified by the generic parameter as elements.

In this Article

[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(false)]
public class SynchronizedCollection<T> : System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<T>, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<T>, System.Collections.Generic.IList<T>, System.Collections.IList

Type Parameters

T

The type of object contained as items in the thread-safe collection.
Inheritance
System.Object
SynchronizedCollection<T>

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

The SynchronizedCollection(T) stores data in a List<T> container and provides an object that can be set and used to synchronize access to the collection so that it is thread-safe. The IList<T> container can be recovered using the Items method. The synchronized object can be recovered using the SyncRoot property. It can only be set using one of the constructors that take the syncRoot parameter.

Constructors

SynchronizedCollection<T>()

Initializes a new instance of the stem.Collections.Generic.SynchronizedCollection`1 class.

public SynchronizedCollection ();

SynchronizedCollection<T>(Object)

Initializes a new instance of the stem.Collections.Generic.SynchronizedCollection`1 class with the object used to synchronize access to the thread-safe collection.

public SynchronizedCollection (object syncRoot);
syncRoot
System.Object

The object used to synchronize access the thread-safe collection.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

syncRoot is null.

Remarks

If multiple instances of the SynchronizedCollection<T> are created using the same syncRoot, then access is protected across all instances.

SynchronizedCollection<T>(Object,IEnumerable<T>)

Initializes a new instance of the stem.Collections.Generic.SynchronizedCollection`1 class from a specified enumerable list of elements and with the object used to synchronize access to the thread-safe collection.

public SynchronizedCollection (object syncRoot, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<T> list);
syncRoot
System.Object

The object used to synchronize access to the thread-safe collection.

list
IEnumerable<T>

The stem.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1 collection of elements used to initialize the thread-safe collection.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

syncRoot or list is null.

SynchronizedCollection<T>(Object,T[])

Initializes a new instance of the stem.Collections.Generic.SynchronizedCollection`1 class from a specified array of elements and with the object used to synchronize access to the thread-safe collection.

public SynchronizedCollection (object syncRoot, T[] list);
syncRoot
System.Object

The object used to synchronize access the thread-safe collection.

list
T[][]

The Array of type T elements used to initialize the thread-safe collection.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

syncRoot or list is null.

Properties

Count

Gets the number of elements contained in the thread-safe collection.

public int Count { get; }
Value
Int32

The number of elements contained in the thread-safe, read-only collection.

Item(Int32)

Gets an element from the thread-safe collection with a specified index.

public T this[int index] { get; set; }
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the element to be retrieved from the collection.

Value
T

The object in the collection that has the specified index.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The index specified is less than zero or greater than the number of items in the collection.

Items

Gets the list of elements contained in the thread-safe collection.

protected System.Collections.Generic.List<T> Items { get; }
Value
List<T>

The stem.Collections.Generic.IList`1 of elements that are contained in the thread-safe, read-only collection.

SyncRoot

Gets the object used to synchronize access to the thread-safe collection.

public object SyncRoot { get; }
Value
System.Object

An object used to synchronize access to the thread-safe collection.

Methods

Add(T)

Adds an item to the thread-safe, read-only collection.

public void Add (T item);
item
T

The element to be added to the collection.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The value set is null or is not of the correct generic type T for the collection.

Clear()

Removes all items from the collection.

public void Clear ();

ClearItems()

Removes all items from the collection.

protected virtual void ClearItems ();

Contains(T)

Determines whether the collection contains an element with a specific value.

public bool Contains (T item);
item
T

The object to locate in the collection.

Returns
Boolean

true if the element value is found in the collection; otherwisefalse.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The value set is null or is not of the correct generic type T for the collection.

CopyTo(T[],Int32)

Copies the elements of the collection to a specified array, starting at a particular index.

public void CopyTo (T[] array, int index);
array
T[][]

The destination Array for the elements of type T copied from the collection.

index
Int32

The zero-based index in the array at which copying begins.

GetEnumerator()

Returns an enumerator that iterates through the synchronized collection.

public System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator<T> GetEnumerator ();
Returns
IEnumerator<T>

An stem.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator`1 for objects of the type stored in the collection.

IndexOf(T)

Returns the index of the first occurrence of a value in the collection.

public int IndexOf (T item);
item
T

Removes all items from the collection.

Returns
Int32

The zero-based index of the first occurrence of the value in the collection.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The value set is null or is not of the correct generic type T for the collection.

Insert(Int32,T)

Inserts an item into the collection at a specified index.

public void Insert (int index, T item);
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the element to be retrieved from the collection.

item
T

The object to be inserted into the collection as an element.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The index specified is less than zero or greater than the number of items in the collection.

ArgumentException

The value set is null or is not of the correct generic type T for the collection.

Remarks

If the index is equal to the number of elements in the collection, the item is appended to the list. If the index is less than the number of elements in the collection, the elements that follow the point of insertion of the item move down to accommodate the new element.

InsertItem(Int32,T)

Inserts an item into the collection at a specified index.

protected virtual void InsertItem (int index, T item);
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the collection where the object is to be inserted.

item
T

The object to be inserted into the collection.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The index specified is less than zero or greater than the number of items in the collection.

ArgumentException

The value set is null or is not of the correct generic type T for the collection.

Remarks

If the index is equal to the number of elements in the collection, the item is appended to the list. If the index is less than the number of elements in the collection, the elements that follow the point of insertion of the item move down to accommodate the new element.

Remove(T)

Removes the first occurrence of a specified item from the collection.

public bool Remove (T item);
item
T

The object to remove from the collection.

Returns
Boolean

true if item was successfully removed from the collection; otherwise, false.

Remarks

The elements in the collection that follow the removed element move up to occupy the vacated spot and their indices are updated accordingly.

RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes an item at a specified index from the collection.

public void RemoveAt (int index);
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the element to be retrieved from the collection.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The index specified is less than zero or greater than the number of items in the collection.

Remarks

The elements in the collection that follow the removed element move up to occupy the vacated spot and their indices are updated accordingly.

RemoveItem(Int32)

Removes an item at a specified index from the collection.

protected virtual void RemoveItem (int index);
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the element to be retrieved from the collection.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The index specified is less than zero or greater than the number of items in the collection.

SetItem(Int32,T)

Replaces the item at a specified index with another item.

protected virtual void SetItem (int index, T item);
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the object to be replaced.

item
T

The object to replace

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The index specified is less than zero or greater than the number of items in the collection.

Explicit Interface Implementations

ICollection<T>.IsReadOnly

Gets a value that indicates whether the collection is read only.

bool System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<T>.IsReadOnly { get; }
Returns
Boolean

false

Remarks

This property always returns false because the collection can be added to and so is not read only.

ICollection.CopyTo(Array,Int32)

Copies the elements of the collection to a specified array, starting at a particular index.

void ICollection.CopyTo (Array array, int index);
array
Array

The destination Array for the elements of type T copied from the collection.

index
Int32

The zero-based index in the array at which copying begins.

ICollection.IsSynchronized

Gets a value that indicates whether the collection is thread safe.

bool System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized { get; }
Returns
Boolean

true

Remarks

This property always returns true because the collection is thread safe.

ICollection.SyncRoot

Gets the object used to synchronize access to the thread-safe collection.

object System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot { get; }
Returns
System.Object

An object used to synchronize access to the thread-safe collection.

Remarks

The value of this syncRoot object can be set when creating the thread-safe collection using the SynchronizedCollection<T>(Object) constructor.

IEnumerable.GetEnumerator()

Returns an enumerator that iterates through the synchronized collection.

System.Collections.IEnumerator IEnumerable.GetEnumerator ();
Returns
IEnumerator

An stem.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator`1 for objects of the type stored in the collection.

IList.Add(Object)

Adds an element to the collection.

int IList.Add (object value);
value
System.Object

The object to add to the collection.

Returns
Int32

The position into which the new element was inserted.

Remarks

The position is given by a zero-based index.

IList.Contains(Object)

Determines whether the collection contains an element with a specific value.

bool IList.Contains (object value);
value
System.Object

The object to locate in the collection.

Returns
Boolean

true if the element value is found in the collection; otherwisefalse.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

value is not an object of the type contained in the collection.

IList.IndexOf(Object)

Determines the zero-based index of an element in the collection.

int IList.IndexOf (object value);
value
System.Object

The element in the collection whose index is being determined.

Returns
Int32

The index of the value if found in the collection; otherwise, -1.

IList.Insert(Int32,Object)

Inserts an object into the collection at a specified index.

void IList.Insert (int index, object value);
index
Int32

The zero-based index at which value is to be inserted.

value
System.Object

The object to insert into the collection.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The index specified is less than zero or greater than the number of items in the collection.

ArgumentException

The value set is null or is not of the correct generic type T for the collection.

Remarks

If the index is equal to the number of elements in the collection, the item is appended to the list. If the index is less than the number of elements in the collection, the elements that follow the point of insertion of the item move down to accommodate the new element.

IList.IsFixedSize

Gets a value that indicates whether the collection is fixed in size.

bool System.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize { get; }
Returns
Boolean

false

Remarks

This property returns false because the collection can be added to and so is not fixed in size.

IList.IsReadOnly

Gets a value that indicates whether the collection is read only.

bool System.Collections.IList.IsReadOnly { get; }
Returns
Boolean

false

Remarks

This property always returns false because the collection can be added to and so is not read only.

IList.Item(Int32)

Gets or sets the item at a specified zero-based index.

object System.Collections.IList.Item[int index] { get; set; }
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the element to be retrieved from the collection.

Returns
System.Object

The item with the specified index.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The value set is null or is not of the correct generic type T for the collection.

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The index specified is less than zero or greater than the number of items in the collection.

IList.Remove(Object)

Removes the first occurrence of a specified object as an element from the collection.

void IList.Remove (object value);
value
System.Object

The object to be removed from the collection.

Remarks

The elements in the collection that follow the removed element move up to occupy the vacated spot and their indices are updated accordingly.
